name: California Sushi Burrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Japanese, Asian Fusion, Poke, Sushi Bars, Fast Food
text: I really really like this place. It was the first place I tried a sushi burrito at and it did not disappoint. I've been here 3 other times since. The food is fresh and tasty, the staff is pretty nice and the atmosphere is super cute and relaxing. If you're in the mood for something new, try his place!!

name: Veggie House
categories: Restaurants, Specialty Food, Japanese, Sushi Bars, Dim Sum, Vegetarian, Food, Ramen, Chinese, Vegan
text: The BEST vegan restaurant in all Las Vegas. Chef Kenny is very talented! Ignore sad look on outside, inside is very nice and the food is 2nd to none. Been coming here for years and the quality is always just like the first time. Excellent!

name: Golden China Chinese Cuisine
categories: Restaurants, Chinese
text: We were looking for a place to eat on a Saturday afternoon. We didn't want to eat at the hotel buffet or snack bar. We decided to get in the car and go up the street about a mile or so and we went into the parking lot for Smith's Grocery store. We've seen Golden China restaurant for many years. Most of the time, it was too late and they were closed. We've always said we would give it a try it.. Well today was the day and it was absolutely delicious. We ordered the special chicken wings and two lunch combos with Kung Pao combo and hot garlic chicken. Can't beat the price with the drink. About 20 bucks! The food is cooked to order, which is a plus. I don't think they use any type of MSG which is marvelous. I'm allergic to MSG anyway. They deliver the food to your table hot and fresh! They even put it in to go containers. It doesn't matter if you're eating there or taking it to go this is the way you get your food. The portions are large. Hubby and I are stuffed and happy.

name: Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.
categories: Comfort Food, Southern, Seafood, Cajun/Creole, Restaurants, American (Traditional)
text: The food was good, and the server got an A for effort. He was sweet, but he seemed a inexperienced. They do offer military discounts! A big plus was the bathrooms were really clean! Always good to find a clean bathroom in such a high traffic place.

name: Bobby's Burger Palace
categories: Salad, Sandwiches, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Burgers
text: Good burgers. Onion rings we're fabulous. Margarita was excellent! Loved the inside and ombiance.

name: Imperial Palace Hotel & Casino
categories: Restaurants, Hotels & Travel, Hotels, Arts & Entertainment, Casinos, Event Planning & Services
text: Imperial Palace is not just outdated because it's old, dingy, and still has popcorn ceilings in the guest rooms. It's outdated because it has this non-specific, non-unique, pan-Asian decor that originated long before the now-common concept of Asian fusion. In fact, Imperial Palace was re-themed in 1979, when using the term "Oriental" was still acceptable. I'm pretty sure nothing has changed since then, even though Asian decor now conjures up bamboo, rich greens and browns, and soft fabrics far more than it does pagodas, blocky script font, or a blue and white color scheme.  My husband and I have been inside Imperial Palace many times before to gamble, check out the celebrity impersonators/dealers (gotta love that Charro wannabe calling out roulette numbers!), and sing at the karaoke lounge (which used to be located downstairs in the little detached space in front of the main entrance and is now inside the main hotel). However, we had never stayed there, choosing instead to spend a bit extra (or on a good weekend, significantly less!) for a hotel that was a lot nicer (our favorites include Aladdin/Planet Hollywood, Bally's, and Mandalay Bay). This particular weekend, however, was Veteran's Day and also happened to be the weekend Madonna was in town for a show and the weekend of a massive bull-riding convention (always forget these kind of things exist!).  Anyway, hotels were a lot more expensive than we were used to paying in Vegas and we were only planning to be in town for the night, so we ended up choosing the Imperial Palace. I knew from the pictures on the web site that the rooms were going to be hideous, but I could never have anticipated just how dingy and unappealing they were. The walls had a yellowish tint, the furniture was peeling, and the concrete on the patio was almost black from various, un-identified stains. We were also weirded out by the sign on the patio door that said "This door may self-lock from the outside." What a relief that we weren't planning to spend a second out there anyway!  I agree that Imperial Palace is in a great location. I also know that most people (like my husband and I) will not spend much time in their hotel room while in Vegas. I also still think that IP is a true, character-filled kind of spot to gamble while you are out and about. However, unless you plan to be with friends (and not with a SO or spouse that you may actually want to be close to) and are truly not snobby about your accommodations (be honest with yourself, people!), you may want to spend a bit extra and actually stay elsewhere. If you do decide to take the plunge, bring some Febreeze and check your diva self at the door!

name: Port of Subs #114
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants
text: It is in an airport and my wife and I ate for 22 dollars.  First, for 2 sandwiches in an airport I usually pay more so the price point is on the low end for airport pricing. My hot pastrami was not the best I have ever had.  It was hot, I could get whatever I wanted on it, and it does the job. For the fools who complain about the quality, price, or a combination of the two remember it is in Las Vegas where your hamburger joints on the strip hit you for 40 dollars for 2, this place isn't a bad deal.

name: Brew Tea Bar
categories: Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Tea Rooms, Bubble Tea, Desserts
text: We have been on the search for a milk tea place since moving out to Vegas. The places we've tried prior to Brew Tea have been ok... but the bubbles have been too soft or inconsistent within my drink. Otherwise, the milk tea has a coffee-ish flavor which is... weird? I wasn't expecting coffee?  Anyways, we decided to try this place out and I'm soo glad we did! It's a little from where we live so unfortunately it's not as convenient to just go on a whim. I ordered the Okinawa Milk tea with bubbles and the BF ordered the honey dew slush with bubbles. Both were delicious and the bubbles were the nice, chewy consistency that I liked. :) :)  The servers there were super nice and it seems like a nice, chill atmosphere to hang out and enjoy the drinks.  Definitely going back in the near future!

name: Parsley Modern Mediterranean
categories: Mediterranean, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Vegan
text: Overall: Parsley had so many good reviews that I was expecting great things, but what I received was less than subpar. Food was mediocre, and my delivery was missing things that I paid extra for. Food: 2 Chicken Kabob Plate: Chicken was well seasoned, but it was unevenly cooked. Some pieces were overcooked and some pieces were actually undercooked. Beef Kabob Plate: Beware that this is actually a kefta (ground beef). It is pretty tasty though! In both plates, the rice was very, very dry and the salad tasted barely seasoned. Delivery: 1 My order was pretty messed up. I specified that I wanted tzatziki, but I got tahini. I paid for extra pita, but I never received it. The only plus side is that they somehow managed to add the right veggies to the salad as specified in my order.

name: The Buffet At Wynn
categories: Food, Buffets, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Beauty & Spas, Hotels, Casinos, Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Day Spas, Breakfast & Brunch
text: This is a great buffet when you are in LV!  They had a variety of food from American, Chinese, Japanese, steak, omelette station, bread and cheese. Oh did I mention the huge dessert island that serves crepes?  If you stay at one of the suites at Wynn you get to go on the VIP line and you so t have to wait in line.  The servers are very friendly and almost every server made sure our beverages is filled to the top.  I will definitely go back at this buffet!

name: Golden Nugget
categories: Event Planning & Services, Buffets, Hotels & Travel, Restaurants, Hotels, Arts & Entertainment, Casinos
text: Stopped in for a drink at the Bar next to the Cashier Cage and to play some video poker.   It isn't much fun being ignored by the bartender who doesn't give a hoot about his job or the guests who sit at "his" bar.  (He must truly believe it is his bar the way he behaves while on duty!)    Three of us must have waited 10 minutes before he would even acknowledge us because he was busy chatting at the end of the bar not two steps from us with someone who already had drinks.  He walked by us three times at a turtle slow pace and still wouldn't glance at us purposely ignoring us.  Heard him mumbling and grumbling about his patrons in a disgraceful manner.   I could go on but don't wish to bore you any longer.  The fact of the matter is... I don't care to gamble at the Golden Nugget on Fremont ever again because of this terrible employee of theirs.

name: Omelet House
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Sandwiches, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch
text: Amazing! The best breakfast deal in the city! The options, quality and quantity of food can't be beat.

name: Fresh Kabob
categories: Restaurants, Mediterranean
text: Best kabobs and bread in town! The meat is tender, juicy, and oh so flavorful. The bread is fresh and tasty. Just love this place!

name: Beijing Noodle No. 9
categories: Food, Restaurants, Chinese
text: I would give negative star if I could! This place just want to rob you! We came here 9:30am planning to have breakfast. We looked at the menu on the touch screen. Even though the price is a little pricey ( $15.99 for the fish congee, we have a baby), we decided to go in. Once we sat down, the waitress handed us a "Late night menu". Found out the price became $21 for the same thing ! A bowl of plain congee cost $15.99!! REALLY???!!! 9:30am is LATE NIGHT?? REALLY???? Feel like they are trying to scam people , especially if you don't look at the menu carefully and if you don't know Chinese food!  Read the other reviews and don't think their food is good!! We left!!

name: Serendipity 3
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, American (Traditional), Arts & Entertainment, Social Clubs, Desserts, Local Flavor, Food, Restaurants, American (New)
text: YUMMMM!!!!  Not a health food spot... However it is soooo delicious!!! Def recommend ;) Salads are actually yummy & def try Frozen hot chocolate or Peanut butter pie

name: Bailiwick
categories: Nightlife, Gastropubs, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Bars
text: Went to Bailiwick at the Orleans last night for the first time and I was sincerely impressed. My purpose was to watch Sunday night football and eat, ha e a few beers. There were big screen TVs all over the sizable establishment and the hostess made sure we had a good seat with a view. The waiter was very attentive, efficient and friendly.  In addition there was a good band playing on the other end where people were having a great time.  The band played good music and it wasn't so loud as to overwhelm my football game  It was a very enjoyable evening

name: Apache Taco Shop
categories: Tacos, Restaurants, Mexican, Desserts, Food, Breakfast & Brunch
text: First time here.  Pleasantly surprised.   Had a California burrito, was delicious and all ingredients were fresh.

name: District One
categories: Seafood, Asian Fusion, Vietnamese, Dive Bars, Sports Bars, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants
text: We went to District One Kitchen & Bar for happy hour on a Wednesday evening.  We sat at the bar and the enthusiastic charming bartender was very friendly and told us what he recommended. Due to being so famished, we ended up ordering everything on the happy hour menu.   Everything was wonderful and delicious.  My favorite was the wings which were spiced to perfection.  Make sure you try the tacos, they were simply amazing. I will definitely go back to try some of the other sea food on their menu.

name: Hobak Korean BBQ
categories: Barbeque, Restaurants, Korean
text: Vampires Safe Zone!  The garlic at this fine establishment is enough so that all Vampires will be banished from the area.  On a date, no problem dude!  The bathroom has mouthwash, toothbrush and toothpaste.  You will still be dazzling and minty fresh for your date! Second time here in a month and I must say, I am simply amazed.  Why would I, he who scarfs down food quicker than you can say "what does Hobak mean in English", be amazed when I eat so fast. That is just it. Normally I am eating so fast I really cannot tell the difference, but here I find that the quality of meat, the marinade, and everything is just, well, as Jungkook of BTS says, "You are the cause of my Euphoria".  Yes, Hobak, you are the cause of my Euphoria. 1. WAIT - Yes, if you are going to go to this place during normal eating hours, be prepared to wait.  No reservations, busy, busy and long lines. This place was built to wait. There is a tremendously large waiting area outside, with misters for the heat. They are prepared for you to wait. 2. PARTY - Just two of us?  We can make it if we try?  Well, that was a great Grover Washington song, but good luck. You are gonna have to wait like everyone else. Big party, small party, they can accommodate nearly all sizes. You just have to wait. 3.  Best time to go with no wait - 3:00 pm or 11:00 am when they open. Mondays are oddly busy and just as odd, Saturday night not as busy...  4.  Pork Belly or Big Belly - Seokjin of BTS famously says, ""Win. Lose. I don't care because at the end of the day I still have this face so who's the real winner here?" So, no matter about the wait no matter about what you order, you are gonna love the food here and I still have a full big belly full of Korean BBQ, so who's the real winner here?  By the way, the Pork Belly is amazing!  5.  Service - Top notch, friendly, they will cook for you and for other tables. They don't miss a beat and they will help you order and help you figure out what to eat with what if you are not on your A game with what to dip in what. 6.  The food - I went for the large Family Combo 1 large because No. 2 son was in town and celebrating his birthday. He works out like crazy and has high metabolism, so he hadn't eaten all day.  This came with Brisket, Pork Belly, Short Ribs and Aged Pork Ribs.  Also ordered the Angus Beef Honey Tartare and some Cold Noodles to polish this off. This was enough for like 6 people and the three of us had plenty to take home. 7.  AYCE - No way. This is not AYCE and frankly, it was much better anyway and plenty of food. 8.  Sugar, oh Honey Honey - While this was a great sone by the Archies, Did you miss my point on the Angus Beef Honey tartare in point 6 above?  This is my sole reason for coming here. Steak Tartare. Raw beef simply seasoned is one of the most amazing dishes that I love to love and here, at Hobak, was the first time I have tried this in a Korean restaurant. No, I wasn't crying. I had allergies.  The Angus Beef Honey tartare is a must if you like it raw. 9.  Speaking of Sugar - if you order the family combo, you get your choice of desert. What else can I say, this place I really like. they are open from 11-11, and pick your time wisely.  Great place to come and enjoy.  When you are done,  don't be shy.  Order desert! We went for the Rice Pop Ice Cream.   They only give you two order with the large family combo, but it was like 8 pieces.  Huge slices of ice cream in a Rice Pop sandwich.  Yep, Almost just like Clemenza said to Rocco in the Godfather, "leave the meat, take the Rice Pop Ice Cream."  You are gonna love it. GK says, check this place out.

name: Mon Ami Gabi
categories: Restaurants, French, Steakhouses, Food, Breakfast & Brunch
text: Great steak that went very well with the wine pairings. I had the French Onion soup and it was just the best onion soup I've had. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  I'm definitely coming back here again in the future.

name: IHOP
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, American (New), Public Services & Government, American (Traditional), Burgers
text: I don't know why I thought this place would improve since the last time I was here ( a year ago). It has not! The service is good with friendly wait staff, but the food is just subpar. My husband and I had breakfast. The toast was hard and dry. The bacon not even edible, very bland. The hash browns were way too crispy and dry. The pancake was good. I have enjoyed the crepes in past visits, but that is not offered on the Senior menu. Also, apparently, you cannot use AARP if you order off the senior menu. Maybe I've learned my lesson!

name: Beauty & Essex
categories: Lounges, Restaurants, Nightlife, American (New), Bars, Tapas Bars
text: We took our daughter here for her 18 Bday with about 10 friends. Have to say I was very impressed by everything the food which she said was the best meal of her life and the ambiance was awesome. Service was stellar and on point the whole evening. Cant wait to go back with some friends to eat and hand out. We will definitely be coming back here for sure.

name: Poke Heaven
categories: Korean, Poke, Food, Asian Fusion, Japanese, Restaurants, Hawaiian
text: A surprising little spot by UNLV. You wouldn't think that a poke place would have good ramen, but it was pretty good for $6. Can't wait to try the poke. I will be back.

name: Ramen Sora
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Noodles, Ramen, Soup
text: I love ramen sora. it's one of my favorite to go places when I'm in vegas. i've tried majority of the broth on the menu and usually get the shoyu which it's done with perfection. Their chashu meat just melts in your mouth so i order more on the side. its always packed here, I've never seen it empty but its definitely worth the wait imo.

name: Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino
categories: Resorts, Hotels, Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Casinos
text: Went to a pool party there Sunday and ended up getting a room and staying the night. The room was huge and really nice. Didn't see much of the other parts of the hotel. The pool party was a blast. Nothing better than techno and drinking at a pool.

name: Fukuburger Truck
categories: Food Trucks, Food, Bagels, Food Stands, Restaurants, Burgers
text: Tried it for the first time last night and was impressed with the food and the atosphere. Music pumping, people hanging out it was a great time. I had the Kinoko and loved all of the flavors in it. I will travel to spring mtn. again just for a FUKUBURGER!!

name: El Pollo Loco
categories: Mexican, Fast Food, Restaurants
text: I was excited they were opening a closer one to me. Normally I go to the one on Charleston. I went and brought the 3 course meal . Spend $35 dollars,  was asked what kind of tortillas I said corn please. They forgot the corn tortillas. I asked for extra avocado on the salad which I got charged for they said they would put it separate, they didn't!!! They also put maybe like five tiny pieces of chicken in the salad looks nothing like the picture. The actual salad looked like it was half empty. And the avocado was brown with a bunch of seasoning on top of it to cover it up. I would honestly take a picture of it but its kind looks disgusting. The chicken was fine. What's funny is that since I had asked for extra things I actually tipped the guy that was the server in the window. But it's fine I will be driving the extra mile to the Charleston location .You would think that a new chain restaurant that just opened up would want to make sure that they are serving the freshest best looking products to make sure that they can build a customer base. Hopefully they get their act together because I was actually looking at the other reviews and they have similar things like the fact that they put moldy tomatoes in the salad. That is disgusting

name: German Bread Bakery
categories: Bakeries, German, Food, Pretzels, Restaurants, Desserts
text: What a fantastic find here in Vegas! I am an AF brat and was born in Germany. My native mother still lives there. We found this bakery from a friend who raved about the place. I was a bit skeptical the first time because I was raised on authentic German baked goods. I have to say that this bakery is completely authentic. The Beesting cake is just as I remember it and the crumb cakes are wonderful. We treat ourselves and go to the bakery early Saturday mornings for the Brotchens. I dont like to buy any other bread except for the bread from GBB.  Like others have said, be sure to go early for the best selection. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is always friendly and courteous and there is never a feeling of being rushed even with the lobby full of customers. I love that they have added German grocery items and always stock up on staples that I cant get anywhere else in Vegas. Definitely give this place a visit. You won't be disappointed

name: TC's Rib Crib
categories: Event Planning & Services, Barbeque, Soul Food, Southern, Caterers, Restaurants, Waffles
text: Came here on T. C. 's 76th birthday  so we had good carrot cake & chocolate cake for dessert after our meal of 1/2 all white BBQ chix with 2 sides ($11.99) & 2 meat combo  beef brisket & pulled pork with 2 sides fried okra & mac n cheese ($14.99).  Our server Mona was so good & personable.  We also won the raffle they had which was a prize of a $10 gift cert & a white T.C.'s Rib Crib Tshirt (the server's are in black Tshirts)

name: Jose Cuervo Tequileria
categories: Mexican, Restaurants
text: Service was good, other than that this place has nothing going for it. I paid 19 dollars for a small burrito that tasted like it was microwaved, and a really insultingly small side of guacamole.  Dining options are limited and lacking in the C terminal but... do yourself a favor and don't eat here. I think this place is here just to capitalize on the old burn outs that come to vegas and just don't care anymore about what they do to their bodies... but want to feel "adventurous," and eat "Mexican," food.

name: District One
categories: Seafood, Asian Fusion, Vietnamese, Dive Bars, Sports Bars, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants
text: Thank you District One for not acknowledging your potential customers.  Was there today and waited to be seated. Place was not busy at all.  Two employees looked at me and went on their merry way. No one said "we'll be right with you". Nothing. We were looking forward to try this place for our Vegas vacation. Thank you for not giving two sh**ts.  Kai the owner,  we loved your Pho So 1.  Please talk to your employees on being more welcoming your customers.  Very DISAPPOINTED.

name: Doña Maria Tamales Restaurant
categories: Desserts, Seafood, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Mexican, Food
text: Definitely nice that they had Wi-Fi here for their customers also lots of interesting pictures of old boxers grace the wall here. Great place for old school boxing fans who love Las Vegas flights to come and have a nice lunch or dinner. Next time I would like to try their tamales reason I gave them a three is because when my soup was brought out it was all over the place and not in the bowl :-/ (it would've been nice if they wiped it first!)

name: Plaza Hotel & Casino
categories: Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Restaurants, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Arts & Entertainment
text: The newly remodeled Plaza is an OK spot to stay when at DTLV. The only thing that is whack is that they charge a resort fee of $10 per person. Are u kidding me a resort fee.... Also, in tbe standard rooms tbe restrooms are TINY!  Other than that the rooms are inexpensive and clean. I'd stay here again.

name: Big Chicken
categories: American (Traditional), Chicken Shop, Restaurants
text: Amazing food! Chicken was excellent and flavorful. The place is nice and clean. The service was great and attentive.

name: Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar
categories: Spanish, Restaurants, Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates
text: This place is my go-to when I'm in Vegas. I've also eaten at fancy places on the Strip, but I'll take Firefly over them! I've only had their tapas, drinks, and Big Bowl salad, but everything has been amazing. For tapas, I've tried: mushroom tart, chicken skewers, petite filet, stuffed dates, ham croquetas, apple and manchego salad, garden variety salad. Each dish has been beautifully presented with a tantalizing combination of flavors. Their sangria and Fly Mule are awesome too! Really, I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. I'll try their paella sometime, but can't seem to get away from the tapas!

name: Pho Bistro
categories: Vietnamese, Restaurants, Chinese
text: Nice little pho place close to home. Probably the best in east Las Vegas!  Spring rolls are always fresh & they have an awesome $5.95 all day lunch special!  Looks like it's family operated, so that makes it feel cozy!

name: Sofrito Rico Authentic Puerto Rican Cuisine
categories: Puerto Rican, Food, Restaurants, Farmers Market, Caribbean, Latin American
text: When a co-worker from Puerto Rico gives her stamp of approval, that means to go check it out! Yes, WE FINALLY have a Puerto Rican restaurant in Vegas! Although not the best I've had, it'll do. I ordered the Alcapurria, Bacalaito, and the Pernil(Roast Pork) with Gandule Rice...and Pasteles to go ;) I enjoyed the flavors and crunchiness of the taro of the Alcapurria, but it is kinda tiny for $3. A better value at the same price is the ginormous Bacalaito. It's like biting into tasty fish and chips  (without the chips ) and this thing was bigger than my hand! The Pernil was a tad bit on the salty/greasy side, and the gandules in the rice were a little hard. I've had softer Pasteles, and SR's version is kinda dense, but okay...personal preference I guess...maybe I'll give it another try later, but for now, it's just shy of being a fan. ALOHA!!! Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  3.5

name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Diners, American (Traditional)
text: The service here was nothing short of fantastic. The food was fresh and delish (what more could you ask for.. right?) I ordered the nachos for an appetizer - they knocked it out of the park.  The Moon over my hammy was my entree. ( the crunch of the buttery toast on this sandwich was amazing ) Ummm.. I think I need one right now..

name: Ruby's Diner
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Burgers, American (Traditional)
text: Poor service, poor food quality. Totally disappointed by this place. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and I laid an extra $5 for extra chicken... besides being tasteless also the quantity was disappinting.

name: SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas
categories: American (Traditional), Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Coffee & Tea, Tapas/Small Plates, Wine Bars, Food, American (New), Tapas Bars, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch
text: The ambiance is classy but cool. The staff is so caring. We waited for our food a bit but they made up for it by giving us complimentary drinks and beignets! Great customer service! Thank you, Will!

name: Mother's Korean Grill
categories: Ethnic Food, Barbeque, Korean, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Vietnamese, Food
text: Charge 18% tip on the bill for 2 guests,  without telling customer before seating, saying it's Christmas day special.  Will not come this restaurant again.

name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
categories: Bars, Salad, Nightlife, Wine Bars, Italian, Restaurants, Soup
text: I have had several items on the menu that I just loved. They were not listed as specials but it seems like every visit they have removed several items. Making it disappointing when you visit just to have a certain dish. But that's the only complaint. Other wise I really like this location it's very nicely done on the inside the fire place is a nice touch. They have several servers whom are amazing. I wish I had all of there names as I know company's  look at these.  The food is great, the braised beef dishes are some of my favorites. And I am really glad that I can have ranch on my salad these days.

name: Island Style Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Korean, Japanese, Asian Fusion, Hawaiian
text: I need to begin with the horrid gangster Asian lady on the phone. I wanted to speak with a manager to inquire about a charge on my credit card, and she just said 'manager not here' and hung up on me. I called back to find out when the manager or if anyone could help me and she yelled like my mother would yell at me asking how I know about the restaurant and how could I have been charged if I haven't been there. What? I just told her I ate there a few days ago. Anyway she yelled again that she is busy and hung up on me again.  They were super friendly taking my money but when there is an issue they certainly don't care.  I ate here twice. Both times the black bean noodles were way too greasy (was trying to give it another try).  The champon seafood noodle soup was ok but just because you throw in a bunch of seafood it doesn't impress me if it isn't quality.  The kimchi fried rice was ridiculously salty so I just took it home and mixed white rice with it.  I think the great reviews exist due to personal taste, and Hawaiian style food is usually cultural not something most people like.  It's not like Italian or sushi where quality is a must, because from reading some reviews about this Island restaurant, quality is not a standard...cockroaches and dirty diapers? Definitely not appetizing.

name: Biscuits Cafe
categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch
text: Food is great. Service slow.  Complained to waitress and was told owner to cheap to hire more people  I told her they will lose more customers We waited 15 minutes to place order Owner needs to fix this problem We feel bad for employees

name: Metro Pizza
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Italian, Restaurants, Pizza
text: I've tried a few different things here...my all time favorite is definitely the meatball sliders. Image a great tasting meatball in a slider....however instead of a regular old bun...it's place in between a soft garlic knot. It's amazing! A new discovery that I decided to try was the Flying Piggle Pizza. Succulent BBQ pulled pork, fried onion strings and butter pickles. THIS IS A MUST HAVE!

name: Mimosas Gourmet
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad
text: This is my new favorite breakfast place. We went here because we had a Groupon, we'll be back wven if we don't. The place is cute and open. The servers are super friendly and helpful. I ordered the bananas foster french toast. It was delicious - warm and gooey, grilled bananas on the side, whipped cream, ice cream, caramel, and toasted walnuts on top. My guy ordered the chicken fried benedict. It had well nade biscuits,  fried chicken, bacon, and country gravy piled on Benedict style, and it came with a side of hash browns. Both dishes were immense and delicious. We saw other dishes being served around us and they looked equally yummy. *If you check in with Yelp they give you a free drink. It says coffee or soda, but they let me get a hot chocolate. ** This place will be even more awesome when they get their liquor license and can serve thwir namesake mimosas.

name: Riviera Hotel & Casino
categories: Hotels, Italian, Restaurants, Arts & Entertainment, Casinos, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: I know that this hotel is so old and really worn down. The staff is almost unseen as it seems that they really only have people at the front desk. I needed a deal as I took my self and the hubby as well as my parents so I went out on a limb and bought the deal. Not my favorite but really not the worst. If you aren't spending a lot of time in the room just for sleeping and shower well I would say not bad. As for bed bugs which I have seen some folks write about we checked and found nothing. Rooms egh BUT the steakhouse was GREAT! We went into the bar for dinner and to watch the World Series. The food, service, atmosphere were excellent! Patty was our lady and she was wonderful! The price was reasonable. Also the comedy show was a blast! The comedians were fun and witty not trashy and vulgar! Overall not bad!

name: Grimaldi's Pizzeria
categories: Restaurants, Pizza
text: We went to Grimaldi's in the Fashion Show Mall off Las Vegas Blvd. We went b/c we had read reviews about it being an allergy friendly restaurant. We have a child who has severe peanut/nut allergy.  Upon being seated our waitress, Yadira was 100% knowledgeable and conveyed that to us and our family when we asked about ingredients and food preparation. If you have an allergy you know how important this is, nothing worse than a server who gives you the "you should be ok" answer.  Not only was the experience great but the pizza was fantastic! Two kids shared a 12" and three adults shared a 16". We probably could of gotten an 18" or we should of gotten an appetizer.  I should also mention it was really busy and we received our meal in 15 minutes. Thin crust oven pizza is apparently pretty quick Definitely recommend Grimaldi pizza

name: Sugar Factory American Brasserie
categories: Specialty Food, Brasseries, American (New), Restaurants, Candy Stores, Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Nightlife
text: I was here in the winter of 2012 and it was great.  I just recently visited again a year later and I was not impressed!  Visited on a Friday night and the music was so loud I couldn't even have a conversation.  Sadly, we left because it was over-priced and too noisy.  If I wanted to go to a night club, I would have.  Decided to return the following day for the real reason I wanted to return there in the first place - happy hour.  Stupidly, they got rid of their happy hour due to a change in management.  BIG MISTAKE!  Due to a lack of happy hour, I left for the second time and went somewhere else.  I think this place is over priced and way too loud.  Unless they decide to have a happy hour again, I will no longer recommend this place or return.  Save your money and go to Max Brenner at Caesar's, they have a terrific happy hour and a chocolate themed menu that is delicious!

name: Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Specialty Food, Food, Ethnic Food, Delis, Taiwanese, Noodles, Chinese
text: I was really craving for Chinese breakfast and would really want to find somewhere with soy milk and you tiao.  The only place I can find thru Yelp is Yi Mei.  However, 3.5 stars makes me skeptical if I should check out this place.  I was really lucky to give it a try! I love the you tiao wrapped in egg and the beef noodle is yummy too! Everything is great, thou service can be improved...

name: Whole Foods Market
categories: Health Markets, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Grocery, Food, Organic Stores
text: I went on an extended trip to Vegas when my daughter was 10 months old. Of course, it was a lot more slow-paced compared to past trips. We also booked a one bedroom apartment-style hotel off the Strip at the Palms Place to have access to a kitchen so I could buy organic ingredients and cook some quality meals for breakfast and for her to take with us whenever we dined out. While I had been to this Whole Foods sans baby twice before to buy snacks, drinks, and ready-to-eat food (which tastes better here than at other Whole Foods in the SF Bay Area).. I had never actually bought produce nor toiletries. For my daughter, I bought air-chilled chicken liver (which I prepared 4x a week at home for my daughter due to her iron deficiency), organic cage-free brown eggs, shredded cheese, organic butter, and organic fruits (blueberries, grapes, satsumas). The satsumas were the most juicy and delicious I had ever tasted and everything else was a hit. Except for the air-chilled chicken liver, which I cooked the same day but emitted such a foul smell when I cooked it that all of us gagged and retched. It was completely inedible. I also forgot some of my daughter's Weleda toiletries and was SO happy to find that Whole Foods carried the brand. Unfortunately, I had to pay 30% more than I had previously paid for them online. Because Whole Foods. Parking is free and convenient.

name: China A Go Go
categories: Restaurants, Chinese
text: Walnut Shrimp to die for!  Whether you dine in, order to go, or have delivery, the Rainbow location gets it right every time.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

name: Joyful House Chinese Cuisine
categories: Restaurants, Chinese, Cantonese, Seafood
text: So, in the car with fellow yelper Trev W. and were in China town looking for a place we haven't been.     I suggest to "just pick any place...    I'm sure it will either be Awesome or it will at least be a story"...       Now the sound of screeching tires...   a wild left turn from the right lane and we were there...    at Joyful House. Once we thanked the gods that we were still alive...  we checked the yelp reviews...      a lot of them... and a really good average.  Alright, looking forward to this. So the place is kinda what I was hoping for...     something that didn't look like a high over-head "Asian Fusion" type place like PF Changs (all do respect to PF...   I do love the Mongolian beef)...   it's simple and to the point...    kinda like a dinner.  Think denny's.   We got seated right away and menus came out to us...   we started looking at stuff but noticed that on the first page were three combo set dinner options...   we made it easy and ordered option 1...( We are not picky...  no food allergies...     we were just hungry) Oh My God...    Come HUNGRY Out comes tea...     that's cool...   then a very large bowl of soup...Sooooo tasty.    Next egg rolls, dumplings, and other assorted fried goodies.....     MMmmmmmmm Ok now rice.   Not a little but a huge plate of the rice along with chicken chow mien...     man...    there was a lot of food....  but wait there's more Two more huge family style plates of noodles and sweet and sour chicken.   Table now covered in food...  and good food.   We ate and we ate but alas...   we barely ate half of it.     Listen if you're looking for the Vegas Strip style place...   this is not your place.   If you want to be seated and fed in a relaxed, local and unpretentious place, then give this a shot.    I've read some of the other reviews about the bland food and what not and I feel bad for those people that they had a bad experience.    Clearly they came on an off day because what we got was great....      Now I just need to go and digest....      Soooooo   Fuuuuuuullllll PS    My fortune cookie was empty...   I have no fortune...    Oh my god I'm gonna die!!!!    Ok maybe not

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Steakhouses, Nightlife
text: Some clients came into town and said they wanted pork belly and comfort food late at night. I took them right over to Cleaver.  We started with some Pappy Van Winkle and the night only got better once the food arrived. Pork belly Mac n Cheese. Out server Charlie made sure to bring us some of the chili oil to put on it. Wonderful!  The bone marrow with the blueberry reduction was delicious.  It went into the toast points with the greatest of ease. We moved to the steak tartare. Crispy and flavored with mustard and capers this was a sure win. Lastly was the spicy mussels. They were good but the sauce NEEDS to be bottled. This sauce was made for pasta and toast and anything else you can imagine.  Make sure you stop in and try this place. The bartenders are artists and the restaurant is beautiful.  It's a cant miss.

name: Max Brenner
categories: Desserts, Food, Chocolatiers & Shops, Breakfast & Brunch, Nightlife, American (New), Restaurants, Bars, Specialty Food, Coffee & Tea
text: You HAVE to try the hazelnut cream chocolate milkshake and their cheesy cheesy mac and cheese (add the chicken it's totally worth it). Friendly staff. Great atmosphere you can smell the chocolate from a 100 feet away.

name: Nothing Bundt Cakes
categories: Cupcakes, Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Restaurants
text: Nothing Bundt Cakes never fails. All of their cakes are always delicious. My personal favorite is the classic vanilla. I go to the northwest location since I live so far but I had to stop by since I was in the area. The staff was very welcoming and polite. They offered a sample of the new pumpkin spice, which was delicious as well. The gentleman who had helped us was great! My wife only wanted a classic vanilla bundlet and he provided it to us "on the house" since he was joking about me being a football fan of a specific team. I didn't expect him to do that but it shows that they appreciate their clients. If I could give more stars, I would.  Thank you for providing the best bundt cakes ever.

name: 48th and Crepe
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants
text: Quick, reasonably priced, and TASTY!! I had the steak and mushroom and my gf had the ham and cheese; better than any Philly cheesesteak I've ever had!

name: Michael Mina Pub 1842
categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, Bars, Gastropubs, Irish, Pubs
text: Awesome! We told them we were in a rush (had a show) and they gave us our food in minutes. Also they had an outstanding pinot by the glass.

name: Sushi Koma
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text: The food was incredible we ordered so many rolls you can't go wrong with any choice. Really good service everyone is so friendly and so sweet. The art on the wall is so cute. You will definitely want to come back.

name: Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers
text: I had high Hope's and was not disappointed. I was a fan of the show. I followed season 17 and the winner Michele Tribble.  I had the beef wellington. The plate was cooked to perfection. The steak was cooked to perfection and almost melted in your mouth. I also had the crispy skin salmon and again perfection. We sat with a large party and they served all the courses together and didn't drag one dish. The sticky toffee dessert was OMG. The portions were very generous and I did not leave hungry.  5 stars on everything.

name: Sunrise Coffee
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Restaurants, Bakeries, Tea Rooms, Coffee & Tea, Food, Cafes, Vegetarian, Vegan
text: Great Coffee and Terrific service! The people working here actually seem like they want to be there, and it is reflected in their customer service, very genuine. New favorite place!

name: Mr. Lucky's 24-7
categories: American (Traditional), Steakhouses, American (New), Restaurants, Diners
text: This place is so damn good! I ate here literally everyday for my stay at the hard rock. Omg like there food is so good and the people there is so nice. The portions of their food is big but omg like i wish hawaii had this place because i would eat their everyday like foreals. If you haven't tried this place you guys should definitely check it out. They even have good specials too.

name: Ohana Hawaiian Bbq
categories: Barbeque, Restaurants, Hawaiian
text: Every time we order ... is every time we happy. Like this place on this location. Nice chef & also nice cashier

name: Red Square Restaurant & Vodka Lounge
categories: Restaurants, Russian, Arts & Entertainment, Cocktail Bars, American (Traditional), American (New), Nightlife, Steakhouses, Casinos, Lounges, Bars
text: Came here to celebrate a birthday.  The food was good but not for the price.  Had the smoked salmon pizza for an appetizer.  That was the best part of the dining experience because I got the fish for my entree and I can't remember what type it was, that's how memorable my fish was.  I can tell you this, I left still hungry because there was no starch on my plate though someone at the table got the scallops and their meal came on a bed of pasta (they said it was delish) our meals were approx. the same price but mine looked like a hocky puck and theirs looked like a family style meal at "Buca Di Beppo" I kept waiting for the server to bring over a side of carbs in hopes that they forgot by mistake but it never happened.  I guess I could have purchased a side but who wants to buy more food at an over priced restaurant?  I keep forgetting to decide on my meal choice by flipping through Yelp review photos.  I would have definitely skipped the bland fish.

name: THE Steak House
categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants
text: If you can ignore the cheap smokey casino that you have to walk through you will find the best food on the strip!  It is hard to ignore the walk through the casino all dolled up for a fancy restaurant when everything around is stinky and cartoonish.   However, once you arrive to the doors of The Steakhouse you are made exclusive.  You will be greeted and escorted to your table.  The team of waiters were there at every beck and call without me really having to make any requests at all.  I ordered the petite filet mignon which was still huge.  For an appetizer, oysters on a half shell which were also great.  I will be back again!  This place has my heart!

name: Dae Jang Keum Korean BBQ & Tofu Restaurant
categories: Barbeque, Restaurants, Korean
text: Come in at 9 am... yes you heard me... 9 am. AHAHAHA recoving from a night on the strip. Anyways being from the Midwest and not having many Korean BBQ places, this place was actually amazing to me. We ordered a lot of food, for three girls xD. and ate all of it. The staff was super nice, probably because we were the only ones there and probably because they thought we were still drunk. Anyways, the pricing here was actual cheap ( I thought) compared to the Korean BBQs in Kansas City. Then again, all the restaurants Ive been to in Vegas, I thought were cheap.  Next time Im back in Vegas, Ill be here again =D P.S they have a wall filled with Korean stars, and they were surprised that I knew half of them ahahaha.

name: Golden Nugget
categories: Event Planning & Services, Buffets, Hotels & Travel, Restaurants, Hotels, Arts & Entertainment, Casinos
text: the wife got here boot beer here which was cool and we had breakfast here as well pretty nice for a older place in vegas i prob would stay here even.

name: Black Tap - Las Vegas
categories: Restaurants, Bars, Burgers, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Nightlife, Chicken Wings, American (Traditional), Beer Bar
text: BLACK TAP! A PLACE TO BE! had such a great time at this place!  you NEED to see their shakes! OH MY! i was not disappointed!  food was also really good! GO! check out this video and see from a customers view! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DtA6_RnzqN0&t=39s

name: Spearmint Rhino Las Vegas
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Adult Entertainment
text: Review #300! :) Honestly the best adult entertainment venue in Vegas with the best lookin' ladies.  Call for the limo, tip the driver, get into the establishment without the cover charge.  Bring cash.  ENJOY.

name: Yardbird Southern Table & Bar
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Southern, Nightlife, Bars, Cocktail Bars
text: this restaurant is located inside Venetian Hotel and casino. A group of us came her for dinner to try their Southern dishes. The place was a full house and was very loud which isn't my kind of tea but it's the Strip so that's to be expected. Some of the items we had -Fried Green Tomato 'BLT' that consists of pork belly, greens, tomato jam, with house-made pimento cheese; Lewellyn's Fine Fried Chicken; Grits -Nora Mill cheesy grits. They were tasty and delightful. The crispy chicken buttermilk biscuits was just ok.  I thought it was pricey as well but the food was good. The service was ok. Make sure you call for the exact number of people coming for reservations.

name: Noodle Asia
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Noodles, Asian Fusion
text: If I could just rate the service I would give them 4 stars but the food left much to be desired. So much so that most of it was left on the table. I wouldn't recommend ordering any chicken dishes as the chicken had a strange taste.

name: KJ Kitchen
categories: Chinese, Restaurants, Seafood
text: Still the most consistent, affordable, quality, authentic Chinese food in town.  Call ahead for a reservation if you're going to dine during busy hours.. Oh and don't forget about the awesome lunch deals they have Monday-Friday!

name: L & L Hawaiian Barbecue
categories: Restaurants, Hawaiian, Event Planning & Services, Barbeque, Caterers
text: The place is clean, the staff are nice. I like the BBQ mix plate and chicken Katsu there MUST TRY IT. And also they have a lot of specials.

name: Memphis Championship Barbecue
categories: Restaurants, Barbeque, Venues & Event Spaces, Event Planning & Services, Southern
text: I had been looking for some good bbq brisket. I had the brisket, collard greens and red beans and rice, with unsweetened apple blossom tea. The meal was good but the brisket was leaner than I am used to. I like the fat that is on one side, gives the meat a extra flavor. I could taste a slight smoke flavor but seasoning was kind of boring. They had some bottled seasoning called magic dust that added some flavor but I liked it better on the potatoe salad my fiance had than on the meat. Side portions were alittle small but the meat portion was ample. It came with a dinner roll and extra cornbread muffins were .49 cents. I would have liked if the muffins came with all the meals standard. or give an option for roll or muffin. All in all it was good but not great. Maybe next time I will try baby back ribs...It was just ok...not finger licking outstanding. We shareda  slice of pecan pie. It was good, sweet, we wanted warm and got a microwaved warm piece of pie. the center was cold, I will have to say the potato salad, tea (which comes in huge mason jars), and pie were my favorites. My fiance got the catfish, which was one big fillet, he said is good but I did not try. He loves the corn muffins and tea. On second thought, I may not go back for another visit and continue my quest to another joint.

name: Bachi Burger
categories: Asian Fusion, Bars, Burgers, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Food, Nightlife, American (New)
text: worth the try. Nice fusion style burger. I have ordered the Kiki burger and Miyagi. Both, I think, is quite awesome.

name: Dirt Dog - Las Vegas
categories: Hot Dogs, Restaurants, Food, American (Traditional), Desserts, Gastropubs, Street Vendors, American (New)
text: One of my favorite places in Vegas to eat. They are know for their "Dirty" bacon-wrapped hot dogs with all types of delicious toppings. Today I had the Pastrami dog on a lobster roll and elote fries, SO GOOD! There so much flavor- I've never had anything like it. Same with the elote fries, the fries are fried perfectly and they don't get soggy, crunchy outside with a soft inside. It looks really cool, there's a map of Vegas on one wall and you put a flag marker on your neighborhood. There's also a a hot sauce wall with about 50 different kinds. The playlist is always good- old skool hip-hop. Great vibe!

name: Windy City Beefs N Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Hot Dogs
text: FYI Grand Opening is today & all dine-in orders are 50% off 1/25/13 til 10pm! Why are you still reading this, go there now! This is an update for a multi meetup event on 1/17/13. If you look at the pics I posted (the ones with the signs that say what each pizza is) you will see an amazing variety of pies.  The owners Tim and Dakota were very accommodating, they met with our organizers a week prior to discuss the setup and what we expected. Even though they do not have salads on their menu, they went out of their way to provide us with a large tossed salad so we could have it served with our pizzas. Our group had it set up as "communal style" so we can try several different pizzas and there is something for everyone. Tim and Dakota set up some tables near the front and set it up buffet style, and brought out a couple different pizzas every 15 or 20 minutes so that the food was hot during the event.  They had plenty of tables set up for our group of 32+ people, and there was plenty of room to move around and socialize. Their waitstaff was attentive and came over several times during the course of our event to check on us. We went to the counter to order our own beverages. They also allowed us to bring in beer and wine since their liquor license is not in yet.  Everyone in the group was happy and it was a very fun time, nice atmosphere. Nice flat screens are on the walls and the room is brightly lit. Very positive feedback from all, I did not hear one complaint which is huge (because there is always one in every crowd).  Here is what we ordered: Thin Crust:  Ultimate Veggie (green pepper, onion, mushroom and tomatoes)  Sausage Classic (sausage, green pepper, mushroom, onion)  White Pizza (olive oil, ricotta, garlic, tomatoes)  Cheese  Pepperoni/Bacon  Pepperoni Deep Dish:  Cheese [note: this was REALLY GOOD!!! Cooked perfectly, gooey cheese, delicious sauce, oh my!!!] Sausage/Onion  Meat Special (Sausage, Pepperoni, Ground Beef & Bacon)  WCBPN Loaded (Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Mushrooms, Onions, Green Peppers & Black Olives)  Ground Beef/Mushroom FYI they don't have the NBA or Ice package but when your sports games are on regular TV this is a great place to watch some sports. I will be back with a group to watch the Chicago Bulls and Blackhawks games because it IS "Windy City pizza!"

name: Gallagher's Steakhouse
categories: Restaurants, Steakhouses
text: I want to see you stand outside and take a look at all those delicious steaks dry aging in the window and tell me your stomach isnt dragging you inside. Interior decor and vibe reminds me of NY for sure.  Small, somewhat cramped seating.  Barely room to put all your food on the table. Let's get to the best part, I had the ribeye and it was absolutely delicious.  The glaze on that bad boy made it so delectable.  Size was big, cooked perfectly!! Apps were just ok, nothing that really stood out to me.  Had the clam chowder, bruschetta and caprese salad. Service was wonderful, every waiter we had was on top of what they were responsible for. We came for our anniversary and they certainly did their best to make us feel special :) Sad, we'd venture into fancier restaurants wouldnt get the same service, so it was definitely appreciated here! I'll definitely be back!!

name: Flower Child
categories: Vegetarian, Salad, Restaurants, American (New)
text: Flower child is a new unique addition to the Summerlin area. The concept is very California and totally enjoyable. The food is very good and even some items fantastic. There will never be enough healthy restaurants in our area that taste great and have an enjoyable atmosphere. Try this place! There is a poster of Twiggy on the wall in the dining room that just shocked me. Life is great and enjoy the flower children.

name: Red Rice
categories: Restaurants, Ethnic Food, Comfort Food, Food, Barbeque, Salad, Event Planning & Services, Hawaiian, Caterers, Specialty Food, Guamanian, Local Flavor, Asian Fusion
text: Like this place.. even far from me.. when i get a chance i grab some homemade food from here..671

name: Sura BBQ Buffet
categories: Buffets, Barbeque, Restaurants, Korean
text: Lunch is $18 and dinner is $25. Much better for the money than Vegas buffets. Unlike most ayce Korean BBQ, you directly get the food to grill yourself and they have a wide variety. Kalbi is only at dinner.  They have a small salad bar, about 8 meats, a sushi bar, some Chinese dishes, and some Korean side dishes. The place is very clean and their ventilation system ensures its not smoky inside. Best Korean BBQ I have ever been to and I have been to a lot.

name: Pier 215
categories: Asian Fusion, American (New), American (Traditional), Japanese, Restaurants, Seafood, Sushi Bars
text: Fabulous decor and such fun lunch at atmosphere! Most of our table got the Sushi lunch, which was a ton of food. Sushi was super fresh and tasty!! Will definitely be back!!!.

name: Flamingo Pizza
categories: Pizza, Restaurants
text: Our order took over two hours to arrive.  Not only was our order late, most of the food was horrible. The only thing that was good was the side salad. The pasta was bland. The chicken wings were too. It might have been ok if we had some hot sauce, or even salt and pepper?? So, if you decide to order from this place, I have two words for you "side salad".

name: True Food Kitchen
categories: Vegan, American (New), Restaurants, Vegetarian
text: We love true food kitchen and have been to multiple locations, including 3 in California and 1 in Scottsdale. The food has always been amazing and consistently great. We've now tried the Vegas location 4 times and the food sadly is just not the same quality at all that we've experienced in other locations. I'm still happy there is one in Vegas finally, but it's definitely the lowest scoring location for food taste that we've experienced.

name: SkinnyFATS
categories: Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food, American (New), Breakfast & Brunch
text: Their food was good. The truffle fries was good , but it wasn't enough to my order. I wish they could put more, but mostly it was good. Next time I will try their chicken and waffles. Their service was friendly and good. The most of all their famous  warm chocolate chip cookies was the best. It was good and very warm. They ran out that night, but when I order the sugar cookies and asked what was taking for long. They asked me if I want the chocolate chip cookies instead. When my friend and I tried, it was very good and very warm. I would go back for more.

name: Blondies Sports Bar & Grill
categories: Restaurants, Sports Bars, American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife
text: More like 3.5/5 $13 for cheese steak sandwich, no fries? Thats strange Service was alright, nothing spectacular I do like the all you can eat Pasta for 9.99 I'd eat here again

name: Tacos El Gordo
categories: Tacos, Mexican, Restaurants
text: Great tacos but they've been closed in the middle of the day on more than one occasion mid week. One would think that lunch rush would be a good time to make money for an eatery.

name: The Venetian Las Vegas
categories: Resorts, Car Wash, Shopping Centers, Shopping, Restaurants, Automotive, Arts & Entertainment, Hotels, Event Planning & Services, Casinos, Hotels & Travel
text: YES 3 stars. The Venetian is DEFINATELY OVER RATED. For the price of a suite I had HIGH expectations, especially from the reviews here. Anyways, the casino itself is nice. Love the design and the paintings on the celings. As far as the hotel goes..I open the door and I say to myself "UH this is it?" Anyway, the Bathroom was small, the tub had no jets, and it was just very disappointing. Not to mention housekeeping forgot to provide us with Robes. And the iron there was OLD and leaking water/broken. The sheets were't that comfortable, although the bed was alright. To call the front desk I had to wait for like 15 minutes. Anyway, I stayed at THE HOTEL @ Mandalay last year and it definately was WAAAY Better than THE VENETIAN and it was about the same price if you find a deal. What else was I not satisfied with this place? Their dresser/cabinets was not adequate to put clothes in at all so I had to live out of my luggage which I HATE. I want to take out my clothes and have somewhere to put them like a DRAWER. There were not enough hangers. The hallways are pretty narrow. It was definatley NOT worth the amount of money I spent here. Anyway, I would not go here again. I would probably go back to THE HOTEL or try Bellagio. Was disappointed with the Venetian =(

name: Casa Don Juan  - Downtown
categories: Restaurants, Seafood, Mexican
text: Hands down our favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Drinks are a hit or miss but their super burrito is the best burrito in Vegas.

name: Sushi Bomb
categories: Restaurants, Japanese, Ethnic Food, Sushi Bars, Specialty Food, Food
text: Honestly, this is my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas! They have the best service with a small restaurant feel. My husband and I would have lunch and dinner here all the time when we lived in the northwest part of town. They have a peanut butter roll that is hands down the best!! Must try!

name: Whole Foods Market
categories: Health Markets, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Grocery, Food, Organic Stores
text: I tend to avoid Whole Foods as a rule of thumb due to the high sense of entitlement exhibited by both customer and employee alike. However, when I do stop by, I'm relegated to the fact that I will grossly overpay for their products. At least the quality of their products is pretty consistent and good. My last trip was the absolute worst. I went in because a friend wanted to use the restroom and decided to get an Arnold Palmer (for those who don't know, it's iced tea & lemonade). Upon checkout, the cashier said it was over $6! I said it can't be right and that her screen reads "smoothie" but she said "I already rang it in and the other counter wrote the code." I asked if she thought $6 was a bit excessive for tea and lemonade and she replied, "no. If you have a problem, you can go back to the other counter, but you still have to pay for this (the drink)."  I reluctantly paid and asked for a receipt and she could not provide one. So, both incompetence and rudeness. I now begin my complete ban of all Whole Foods stores. Way to not care!

name: Lokuras
categories: Restaurants, Desserts, New Mexican Cuisine, Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Mexican, Shaved Ice
text: I went in for the first time and tried the large mixed fruit cocktail, strawberry tamale and a small horchata. Everything was delicious and without a doubt I'll be in for more.

name: California Sushi Burrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Japanese, Asian Fusion, Poke, Sushi Bars, Fast Food
text: Really Good! Ordered a make your own sushi burrito with tofu, avocado and spinach. I really liked it with the cilantro aoili. It came with complimentary sweet potato chips, which were good too. This will definitely be my go to spot when I'm near China Town.

name: Rice & Company
categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, Pan Asian, Chinese, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Asian Fusion, Food
text: Delightfully impressed! I had the pleasure to visit rice & Co for an event and was not disappointed! The sushi was fresh and delicious. I was in love with the dessert that was served it was like biting into a cloud with such an airy feel and incredible taste! The dessert was perfectly paired with a small berry sauce. So delicious and the drink specifically for the night was perfectly paired as well!

name: Catchers Fish House
categories: Restaurants, Seafood, Fish & Chips
text: Place was legit..area it what it is, doesn't bother me..love to see a place like this pop open in my neighborhood

name: Ferraro's Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar
categories: Wine Bars, Nightlife, Bars, Food, Lounges, Italian, Restaurants
text: Fantastic doesn't begin to describe this place.  Eric our waiter would be reason enough to return here on every visit to Vegas!  He is the ultimate professional and has a warm welcoming demeanor.  The food is incredible.  I am a Travel Agent and will be sending every single one of my clients here for supper.  Try the lobster risotto!!!  Thanks for a wonderful experience!

name: Baguette Cafe
categories: Delis, Vegan, Restaurants, French, Food, Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, Cafes
text: We like food and staff very friendly  Be back again Recommend  to anyone, bring your friends with you, you will not regret

name: Bachi Burger
categories: Asian Fusion, Bars, Burgers, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Food, Nightlife, American (New)
text: Slowly sliding down too bad the food really has potential!

name: Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar
categories: Restaurants, Vegan, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Vegetarian
text: I have been here many times, I've used dine in service, ate at the bar, and to order to go by phone and walk in. The food is always great. The service is always great. Violets Vegan Cafe is my number one choice vegan restaurant.

name: Nora's Italian Cuisine
categories: Bars, Wine Bars, Nightlife, Venues & Event Spaces, Event Planning & Services, Pizza, Cocktail Bars, Caterers, Italian, Restaurants
text: Best Italian in Las Vegas! Only downfall is the weird location...  Nowhere to walk off dinner haha.
